body_html:
It is a suggestion, because most methods accept float32 and int32 as default types, and tf.size() and tf.shape() also return int32 by default. But why tf.matrix_band_part() accept int64 by default?
For example, if I try tf.matrix_band_part(input, 0,1), both 0 and 1 will be treated as int64
If I try tf.matrix_band_part(input, 0, tf.shape(xxx)[xxx]), there will be an err, because 0 is treated as int64, but tf.shape() returns int32.
Understand?
body_text:
It is a suggestion, because most methods accept float32 and int32 as default types, and tf.size() and tf.shape() also return int32 by default. But why tf.matrix_band_part() accept int64 by default?
For example, if I try tf.matrix_band_part(input, 0,1), both 0 and 1 will be treated as int64
If I try tf.matrix_band_part(input, 0, tf.shape(xxx)[xxx]), there will be an err, because 0 is treated as int64, but tf.shape() returns int32.
Understand?
body:
It is a suggestion, because most methods accept float32 and int32 as default types, and tf.size() and tf.shape() also return int32 by default. But why tf.matrix_band_part() accept int64 by default? 
For example, if I try tf.matrix_band_part(input, 0,1), both 0 and 1 will be treated as int64
If I try tf.matrix_band_part(input, 0, tf.shape(xxx)[xxx]), there will be an err, because 0 is treated as int64, but tf.shape() returns int32.
Understand?
